original: LÖFQUIST, Axel Fredrik Thure, Civilingenjör, Kungsbacka, f Filipstad 18/7 91 av målar-inäst N G L o Hulda Carlsson, gm Fanny Ringblom. CTH (maskinbyggn o mek tekn) 09—12. Rit v Elektr AB Eck i Partille 12— 13, konstr, ritkont.ch o övering v AB Sv Kugghjulsfabr o SKF 14—27, tekn ch v AB Sv Naxos i Lomma 28, tekn expert o rådgiv h AB Slipmaterial-Naxos, V vik. Lomma o Backarp sed. 40. Resor: Syd- o Mellanamerika, Nordafr o Medelhavsländerna 13—14, Nordamerika 25—26, Österr, Tjeckoslov, Tyskl, Belg, Engl upp ggr. Led av Sv Tekn.frn o Tekn Samf. Hobbies: Böcker, mässingsljusstakar.
translated: LÖFQUIST, Axel Fredrik Thure, Civil Engineer, Kungsbacka, born in Filipstad on July 18, 1891, son of painter N.G.L. Carlsson and Hulda Carlsson, married to Fanny Ringblom. Graduated from Chalmers University of Technology (machinery engineering and mechanical technology) in 1909-1912. Draughtsman at Elektr AB Eck in Partille from 1912 to 1913, construction, drafting office chief and supervisor at AB Swedish Gear Wheel Factory and SKF from 1914 to 1927, technical chief at AB Swedish Naxos in Lomma in 1928, technical expert and adviser at AB Grinding Material-Naxos, V vik. Lomma and Backarp since 1940. Traveled to South and Central America, North Africa, and Mediterranean countries in 1913-1914, North America in 1925-1926, Austria, Czechoslovakia, Germany, Belgium, and England multiple times. Member of the Swedish Institute of Engineering and the Engineering Society. Hobbies: Books, brass candlesticks.

career.occupational_title: Construction, Drafting Office Chief and Supervisor
career.workplace: AB Swedish Gear Wheel Factory and SKF
AB Grinding Material-Naxos, V vik. Lomma and Backarp
